5657390.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657390.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657390
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 001
5657390.text:
Abu Huraira reported God's messenger as saying, "I have been commissioned from among the best of the generations of Adam's descendants, generation after generation, till I came into being in the generation in which I have come." 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5657400.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657400.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657400
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 002
5657400.text:
Wathila b. al-Asqa' told that he heard God's messenger say, "God chose Kinana from the descendants of Ishmael, He chose Quraish from Kinana, from Quraish He chose the B. Hashim, and He chose me from the B. Hashim.'' 

Muslim transmitted it.

In a version by Tirmidhi he said, "God chose Ishmael from among the children of Abraham, and He chose the B. Kinana from among the descendants of Ishmael.' 

Tirmidhi

5657410.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657410.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657410
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 003
5657410.text:
Abu Huraira reported God's messenger as saying, "I shall be preeminent among the descendants of Adam on the day of resurrection, the first from whom the grave will be cleft open, the first intercessor and the first whose intercession will be accepted." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657420.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657420.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657420
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 004
5657420.text:
Anas reported God's messenger as saying, "I am the prophet who will have the greatest number of followers on the day of resurrection, and I shall be the first to knock at the gate of paradise." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657430.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657430.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657430
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 005
5657430.text:
He reported God's messenger as saying, "I shall come to the gate of paradise on the day of resurrection and ask that it be opened. The keeper will ask who I am, and when I tell him that I am Muhammad he will reply that he has been given orders regarding me not to open to anyone before me." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657440.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657440.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657440
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 006
5657440.text:
He reported God's messenger as saying, "I shall be the first intercessor in paradise, no prophet having been believed to the extent I have. Among the prophets there is one who was believed by only one man out of his people." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657450.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657450.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657450
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 007
5657450.text:
Abu Huraira reported God's messenger as saying, "The way in which I may be compared with the prophets is by a castle which was beautifully constructed, but in which the place of one brick was left incomplete. Sightseers went round admiring the beauty of its construction with the exception of the place for that brick. Now I have filled up the place of that brick, in me the building is completed and in me the messengers are complete." A version has "I am the brick and I am the seal of the prophets." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657460.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657460.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657460
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 008
5657460.text:
He reported God's messenger as saying, "No prophet has failed to be given a miracle which caused men to believe in him when it was seen What I have been given is simply a revelation which God gave to me and I hope I may be the one of them who will have the largest following on the day of resurrection." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657470.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657470.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657470
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 009
5657470.text:
Jabir reported God s messenger as saying, "I have been given five things which no one before me has been given: I have been helped by terror [being put in the hearts of enemies] as far as a month's journey away, the earth has been made for me a place of worship and ceremonially pure, so that when the time of prayer comes any man of my people may pray; spoils have been made lawful to me, but were not made lawful to anyone before me; I have been granted the right of intercession; and prophets were formerly sent to their people alone, whereas I have been sent to all mankind." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657480.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657480.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657480
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 010
5657480.text:
Abu Huraira reported God's messenger as saying, "I have been given superiority over the prophets in six respects: I have been given words which are concise but comprehensive in meaning; I have been helped by terror [in the hearts of enemies] ; spoils have been made lawful to me; the earth has been made for me a place of worship and ceremonially pure; I have been sent to all mankind; and the line of prophets is closed with me." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657490.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657490.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657490
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 011
5657490.text:
He reported God's messenger as saying, "I have been commissioned with words which are concise but comprehensive in meaning; I have been helped by terror [in the hearts of enemies]; and while I was asleep, I saw myself being brought the keys of the treasures of the earth which were placed in my hand."

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657500.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657500.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657500
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 012
5657500.text:
Thauban reported God's messenger as saying, "God gathered together the earth for me and I saw its eastern and western parts. My people will attain to rule over it so far as it was gathered together for me. I have also been given the two treasures, viz. gold and silver[*]. I asked my Lord not to destroy my people by a general famine, or to allow an enemy from another people to rule over them and uproot them, and my Lord replied, `When I decree something, Muhammad, it cannot be averted, but I have granted you for your people that I shall not destroy them by a general famine, or allow an enemy from another people to rule over them and uproot them, even though those in all quarters of the earth were to unite against them in order that they might destroy one another and take one another captive'." 
*Literally, "the red and the white."

Muslim transmitted it.

5657510.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657510.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657510
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 013
5657510.text:
Sa'd said: Passing the mosque of the B. Mu'awiya, God's messenger entered and prayed two rak`as in it and we prayed along with him. He made supplication to his Lord for a long time and then went away. He then said, "I asked my Lord for three things two of which He granted me, but one of which He refused me. I asked my Lord not to destroy my people by famine and He granted me that; I asked Him not to destroy my people by drowning and He granted me that; I asked Him not to let war arise among them but He refused me that." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657521.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657521.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657521
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 014
5657521.text:
`Ata' b. Yasar told that he met `Abdallah b. `Amr b. al- `As and asked him to inform him of the description of God's messenger given in the Torah. He agreed, swearing by God that he was certainly described in the Torah by part of the description of him given in the Qur'an when it says, "0 prophet, We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good tidings, and a warner[1], and a guard for the common people. You are my servant and my messenger; I have, called you the one who trusts, not harsh or rough, nor loud-voiced in the streets. He will not repulse evil with evil, but will- pardon and forgive, and God will not take him till He uses him to straighten the crooked creed so that people may say there is no god but God, and opens thereby blind eyes, deaf ears and hardened hearts[2]." 
 Quran; 33:45.
 Reminiscent of Isaiah 42; 1-4.

Bukhari transmitted it, and Darimi also gives something to the same effect on the authority of `Ata who gave as his authority Ibn Salam.

5657540.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657540.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657540
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 015
5657540.text:
Khabbab b. al-Aratt said: God's messenger led us in prayer and prolonged it, and when the people said, "Messenger of God, you have prayed a prayer such as you have not been accustomed to pray," he replied, "Yes, it was a prayer of hope and fear during which I asked God for three things, two of which He granted me but one of which He refused me. I asked Him not to destroy my people by famine and He granted me that, I asked Him not to let an enemy from another people rule over them and He granted me that, and I asked Him not to let them experience one another's violence but He refused me that." 

Tirmidhi and Nasa'i transmitted it.

5657550.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657550.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657550
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 016
5657550.text:
Abu Malik al-Ash'ari reported God's messenger as saying, "God who is great and glorious has protected you from three things: that your prophet should not invoke a curse on you and you should all perish, that those who follow what is false should not prevail over those who follow the truth, and that you should not all join in an error." 

Abu Dawud transmitted it.

5657560.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657560.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657560
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 017
5657560.text:
'Auf b. Malik reported God's messenger as saying, "God will not cause two swords to smite this people together, one from among itself and one from its enemy." 

Abu Dawud transmitted it.

5657570.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657570.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657570
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 018
5657570.text:
Al 'Abbas told that he came to the Prophet who seemed to have heard something and so mounted the pulpit and asked, "Who am I?" On being told that he was God's messenger he said, "I am Muhammad son of `Abdallah son of Abd al-Muttalib. God created all creatures and placed me among the best of them, then put them in two sections[*] and placed me in the better section, then made them into tribes and placed me in the best tribe, then made them into families and placed me in the best family, and I am inherently the best of them and come of the best family."
*Mirqat; 5:366, explains this as meaning Arabs and foreigners, with which may be compared the contrast between Jews and Gentiles, or Greeks and barbarians. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657580.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657580.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657580
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 019
5657580.text:
Abu Huraira told that when God's messenger was asked when the office of prophet had been established for him, he replied, "When Adam had not yet had his spirit joined to his body." 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657591.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657591.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657591
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 020
5657591.text:
Al- `Irbad b. Sariya reported God's messenger as saying, "I was inscribed in God's presence as the seal of the prophets when Adam was prone in his basic substance[1]. I shall inform you about the beginning of my career: it was the petition of Abraham[2], the good tidings by Jesus[3], and the vision my mother saw when she gave birth to me and a light issued to her from which the castles of Syria shone for her."
1. i.e., the substance to which bodily form was to be added and to which the soul was to be joined. The tradition says Muhammad was inscribed in God's presence as the seal (i.e., the last) of the prophets before Adam's creation was complete. 
2. Cf. Quran; 2:129. 
3. Cf. Quran; 61:6

It is transmitted in Sharh as-sunna, and Ahmad transmitted it on the authority of Abu Umama from "I shall inform you . . .'' to the end.

5657610.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657610.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657610
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 021
5657610.text:
Abu Sa'id reported God's messenger as saying, "I shall be preeminent among the descendants of Adam on the day of resurrection, and this is no boast; and in my hand will be the banner of praise, and this is no boast. There will be no prophet, Adam or any other, who will not be under my banner. I shall be the first from whom the earth will be cleft open, and this is no boast." 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657620.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657620.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657620
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 022
5657620.text:
Ibn 'Abbas told that when some of the companions of God's messenger were sitting, he came out, and when he came near them, he heard them discussing. One of them said God had taken Abraham as a friend[1], another said He spoke direct to Moses[2], another said Jesus is God's word and spirit[3], and another said God chose Adam[4]. God's messenger then came out to them and said, "I have heard what you said, and you wonder that Abraham was God's friend, as indeed he was; that Moses was God's, confidant, as indeed he was; that Jesus was His spirit and word, as indeed he was; and that Adam was chosen by God, as indeed he was. I am the one whom God loves, and this is no boast. On the day of resurrection, I shall be the bearer of the banner of praise under which will be-Adam and the others, and this is no boast. I shall be the first intercessor and the first whose intercession is accepted on the day of resurrection, and this, is no boast. I shall be the first to rattle the knocker of paradise, and God will open for me and bring me into it accompanied by the poor ones among the believers, and this is no boast. I shall be the most honourable in God's estimation among those of earliest and latest times, and this is no boast." 
1. Cf. Quran; 4:125. 
3. Cf. Quran; 4:171. 
2. Cf. Quran; 4:164. 
4. Cf. Quran; 3:33

Tirmidhi and Dirimi transmitted it.

5657630.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657630.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657630
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 023
5657630.text:
`Amr b. Qais reported God's messenger as saying, "We are the last, but we shall have precedence on the day of resurrection. I am saying something which is not a boast: Abraham was God's friend, Moses was God's chosen one, and I am God's belove done who will have the banner of praise on the day of resurrection. God has given me promises regarding my people and has granted them protection from three things: He will not bring on them a universal famine, an enemy will not extirpate them, and He will not cause them all to unite in an error." 

Darimi transmitted it.

5657640.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657640.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657640
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 024
5657640.text:
Jabir reported the Prophet as saying, "I am the leader (qa'id) of the messengers, and this is no boast; I am the seal of the prophets, and this is no boast; and I shall, be the first to make intercession and the first whose intercession is accepted, and this is no boast." 

Darimi transmitted it.

5657650.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657650.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657650
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 025
5657650.text:
Anas reported God's messenger as saying, "I shall be the first to come forth when mankind are resurrected; I shall be their leader when they present themselves before G od; I shall be their spokesman when they are speechless; I shall be the one who is. asked to intercede for them when they are restrained ; I shall be throne who gives them good tidings when they despair; honour and the keys will on that day be in my hand; the banner of praise will on that day be in my h a n d ; and I shall be the most honourable of the descendants of Adam in my Lord's estimation. A thousand servants like concealed eggs or scattered pearls will go round me." 

Tirmidhi and Darimi transmitted it, Tirmidhi saying this is a gharib tradition.

5657660.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657660.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657660
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 026
5657660.text:
Abu Huraira reported the Prophet as saying, "I shall be clothed with one of the robes of paradise and shall then stand at the right of the Throne, a place where no other creature than I shall stand." 

Tirmidhi transmitted it. The version on his authority in Jami al-usul has "I shall be the first from whom the earth will be cleft open and I shall be clothed...[*]" 
*The tradition begins "and I shall be clothed." but I have omitted the conjunction as it would seem awkward in English. The version beginning with the words "I shall be the first..." makes the conjunction quite natural.

5657670.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657670.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657670
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 027
5657670.text:
He reported the Prophet as saying, "Ask God to grant me the wasila." God's messenger was asked what the wasila meant and replied, "The highest grade in paradise which only one man will attain, and I hope I may be he." 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657680.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657680.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657680
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 028
5657680.text:
Ubayy b. Ka'b reported the Prophet as saying, "On the day of resurrection I shall be the leader (imam) of the prophets, their spokesman, and the one who will intercede for them, and this is no boast." 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657690.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657690.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657690
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 029
5657690.text:
`Abdallah b. Mas`ud reported God's messenger as saying, "Every prophet has friends from among the prophets, and my friend is my father, the friend of my Lord." He then recited, "Those who will be nearest to Abraham are those who followed him, as well' as this prophet and those who believe, and God is the Patron of the believers[*]."

*Quran; 3:63

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657700.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657700.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657700
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 030
5657700.text:
Jabir reported the Prophet as saying, "God has sent me to perfect good qualities of character and to complete good deeds." 

It is transmitted in Sharh as-sunna.

5657710.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657710.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657710
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 031
5657710.text:
Ka'b, quoting the Torah, said we find written, "Muhammad God's messenger, My chosen servant, is not rough, or coarse, or loud-voiced in the streets, he does not require evil with evil, but forgives and pardons. His birthplace will be in Mecca, his place of emigration in Taiba, his kingdom in Syria, and his people will be those who are devoted to praising who praise God in prosperity and adversity, who praise God in every alighting-place, who declare God's greatness on every rising ground, who watch for the sun and observe the prayer when its time comes, who tie their lower garments round their middle, who perform ablution a t their extremities, whose crier summons in the open air, who are the same in fighting as they are in prayer, who make a low sound a t night like the buzzing of bees." 

This is the wording in al-Masabih. Darimi transmitted it with a slight difference.

5657720.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657720.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657720
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 032
5657720.text:
Abdallah b. Salam said the description of Moses is written in the Torah and also that Jesus, son of Mary will be buried along; with him. Abu Maudud[1] said that a place for a grave has remained in the house[2]." 
 One of the transmitters of the tradition. He was `Abd al-`Aziz b. Abu Sulaiman al Madani (d. 62)
 i.e., `Aisha's house.
 
Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657730.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657730.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657730
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 033
5657730.text:
Ibn `Abbas said: God most high gave Muhammad superiority over the prophets and the inhabitants of heaven. On being asked, "In what respect, Abu 'Abbas[1], has God given him superiority over the inhabitants of heaven?'' he replied that God most high said to the inhabitants of heaven, "If any of them says, `I am a god apart from Him,' We shall recompense that one with jahannam. Thus we recompense the evildoers."[2] And God most high said to Muhammad, "We have certainly given you a clear victory, that God may forgive you your former and latter sins[3]." He was asked the nature of his superiority over the prophets and replied that God most high said, "We have sent no messenger who, did not use the tongue of his people to make matters clear to them; then God leads astray those whom He will...[4]" And God most high said to Muhammad, "We have sent you only to all mankind[5]." Then He sent him to jinn and men. 
 This is the kunya of 'Abdallah b. al-'Abbas.
 Quran; 21:29
 Quran; 48:1 f.
 Quran; 14:4
 Quran; 34:28

(Darimi).

5657740.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657740.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657740
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 034
5657740.text:
Abu Dharr al-Ghifari told that he asked God's messenger how he knew he was a prophet so that he was quite sure of it, and that he replied, "Two angels came to me, Abu Dharr, when I was at a place in the valley of Mecca, one alighting on the earth and the other remaining between heaven and earth. One of them asked the other if this was the man, and when he replied that I was, he told him to weigh me against a man. This was done and I was the heavier. He told him to weigh me against ten men, and when this was done, I outweighed them. He then told him to weigh me against a hundred men, and when this was done, I outweighed them. He then told him to weigh me against a thousand men, and when this was done, I outweighed them; and it seemed to me as if I were looking at them being scattered over me because of the lightness of the scale. Then one said to the other that if he were to weigh me against my people, I would outweigh them." 

Darimi transmitted the two traditions.

5657750.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657750.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657750
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 035
5657750.text:
Ibn `Abbas reported God s messenger as saying, "Sacrifice was prescribed for me but not for you, and I was ordered to observe prayer in the forenoon but you were not." 

Daraqutni transmitted it.

5657760.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657760.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657760
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 036
5657760.text:
Jubair b. Mut'im told that he heard the Prophet say, "I have names. I am Muhammad, I am Ahmad, I am al-Mahi (the obliterator) by whom God obliterates infidelity, I am al-Hashir (the gatherer) who will gather mankind at my feet, I am al-'Aqib (the last in succession), al- `Aqib being the one after whom there will be no prophet." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657770.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657770.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657770
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 037
5657770.text:
Abu Musa al-Ash`ari told that God's messenger used to name himself to them in various ways, saying, "I am Muhammad, Ahmad, al-Muqaffi (the follower)[*], al-Hashir, the prophet of repentance and the prophet of mercy." 
*This title indicates that he follows other prophets, being the last. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657780.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657780.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657780
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 038
5657780.text:
Abu Huraira reported God's messenger as saying, `Are you not astonished at the manner in which God turns away from me the reviling and cursing of Quraish? They revile one who is blameworthy (mudhammam) and curse one who is blameworthy, whereas I am Muhammad (praiseworthy)." 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5657790.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657790.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657790
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 039
5657790.text:
Jabir b. Samura told that the front of God's messenger's head and his beard had become grey, and that while this was not visible when he had had his head oiled it was visible when his head was dishevelled. He had a thick beard. When a man remarked that his face was like a sword[*] Jabir replied that that was no so, for it was like the sun and the moon, as it was round. He told that he had seen the seal on his shoulder like a pigeon's egg with the same colour as his body. 
*It has been suggested that this means it was bright, but does not agree with what follows. The context suggests the man meant he had a long face.

Muslim transmitted it.

5657800.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657800.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657800
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 040
5657800.text:
`Abdullah b. Sarjis told that he had seen the Prophet and had eaten bread and meat along with him (or he said tharid). He had then gone round behind him and looked at the seal of prophecy between his shoulders at the end of his left shoulder-blade, a collection of moles on him like warts. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657810.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657810.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657810
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 041
5657810.text:
Umm Khalid daughter of Sa'id. told that once when the Prophet was brought some garments among which was a small black cloak with a border he said, "Bring me Umm Khalid.'' Then when she was carried to him1 he took the cloak in his hand and put it on her, saying, "Wear it out and make it ragged, then wear it out and make it clear[2].'' It had a green, or a yellow, mark on it, and he said, "This is sanah, which means `beautiful' in the language of the Abyssinians." She said that she began to play with the seal of prophecy and that when her father rebuked her God's messenger said, "Leave her alone." 
 Indicating that she was an infant at the time.
 Mirqat, 5:378, says this represents a prayer that she might live long.
 
Bukhari transmitted it.

5657820.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657820.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657820
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 042
5657820.text:
Anas said that God's messenger was neither very tall nor was he short, he was neither pure white nor dark, and his hair was neither very curly nor long. God commissioned him when he had just reached the age of forty. He stayed in Mecca ten years and in Medina ten years, and God took him when he had just reached the age of sixty; and there were not twenty white hairs in his head and beard. In a version he describes the Prophet saying he was a man of average size, neither tall nor short, with a fair complexion; and he said God's messenger's hair came half-way down his ears. Another version says it came between his ears and his shoulder. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

In a version by Bukhari, he said he had a large head and large feet and that he had never seen anyone like him before or since. The palms of his hands were thick[*]. In another version by him he said he had callouses on his feet and hands. 
* The phrase is often used as a figure of speech for generosity, but in the present context it would seem to be meant literally.

Bukhari.

5657830.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657830.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657830
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 043
5657830.text:
Al-Bara' said God's messenger was of medium height, broad. shouldered, with his hair hanging down to the lobes of his ears. He had seen him wearing a red robe and had never seen anything more beautiful than he. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

In a version by Muslim, he said he had never seen anyone with a hanging lock of hair more beautiful when wearing a red robe than God's messenger. His hair reached his shoulders, he was broad-shouldered and neither tall nor short.

Muslim.

5657840.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657840.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657840
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 044
5657840.text:
Simak b. Harb quoted the authority of Jabir b. Samura for the statement that God's messenger had a dali mouth, ashkal eyes and manhush ankles. Simak was asked the meaning of a dali mouth and said it meant a large mouth. He was asked the meaning of ashkal eyes and said they were oval[*]. He was asked the meaning of manhush ankles and said there was little flesh on the ankle. 
*Ashkal normally means `reddish white,' here referring to redness in the white of the eye. Cf. Mirqat, 5:380. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657850.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657850.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657850
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 045
5657850.text:
Abut Tufail said he had seen God's messenger, and he was white, good-looking and of moderate size. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657860.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657860.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657860
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 046
5657860.text:
Thabit told that when Anas was asked about God's messenger's hair dye, he replied that [his hair] did not reach the stage of needing to be dyed, adding that if he (i.e., Anas) wanted he could count the number of grey hairs in his beard. A version says that if he wanted to count the grey hairs which were in his head he could do so. In a version he said the white hairs above his chin, on his temples and on his head were few.

(Bukhari and Muslim,)

5657870.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657870.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657870
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 047
5657870.text:
Anas said God's messenger had a clear complexion, his sweat was like pearls and when he walked, he bent forwards. He said he had not touched brocade or silk which was softer than the palm of God's messenger's hand, or smelt musk or ambergris sweeter than the Prophet's odour. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657880.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657880.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657880
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 048
5657880.text:
Umm Sulaim told that the Prophet used to visit her and have a siesta in her house, and she would spread out a leather cloth on which he had his siesta. He sweated profusely, and she would collect his sweat and put it in perfume. The Prophet asked, "What is this, Umm Sulaim?" and she replied, "It is your sweat which we put in our perfume, and it is a perfume of the sweetest type." In a version she said, "Messenger of God, we hope for your blessing on our children," and he replied, "You are right." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657890.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657890.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657890
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 049
5657890.text:
Jabir b. Samura said: I prayed the first prayer along with God's messenger, then he went out to his family and I went out with him. Some children met him and he began to stroke the cheeks of one of them one after the other. He stroked my cheeks, and I experienced a coolness, or a fragrance, in his hand as though he had-brought it out of a scent-bag. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5657900.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657900.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657900
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 050
5657900.text:
`Ali b. Abu Talib said: God's messenger was neither tall nor short, he had a large head and beard, the palms of his hands and his feet were calloused, he had a reddish tinge, he had large joints, the hair on his breast was long, and when he walked, he bent forward as though he were descending a slope. I have never seen anyone like him before or since. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it, saying this is a hasan sahih tradition.

5657910.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657910.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657910
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 051
5657910.text:
When he described the Prophet he said: He was neither very tall nor excessively short, but was a man of medium size, he had neither very curly nor flowing hair but a mixture of two, he was not obese, he did not have a very round face, but it was so to some extent, he was reddish-white, he had wide black eyes and long eyelashes, he had protruding joints and shoulder-blades, he was not hairy but had some hair on his chest, the palms of his hands and his feet were calloused, when he walked he raised his feet as though he were walking on a slope, when he turned round he turned completely, between his shoulders was the seal of prophecy and he was the seal of the prophets, he had a finer chest than anyone else, was truer in utterance than anyone else, had the gentlest nature and the noblest tribe. Those who saw him suddenly stood in awe of him and those who shared his acquaintanceship loved him. Those who described him said they had never seen anyone like him before or since. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657920.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657920.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657920
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 052
5657920.text:
Jabir said the Prophet never walked along a road without one who came along afterwards knowing he had walked along it because of his sweet odour. Or he said, "because of the fragrance of his sweat."

Darimi transmitted it.

5657930.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657930.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657930
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 053
5657930.text:
Abu `Ubaida b. Muhammad b. `Ammar b. Yasir told that he asked ar-Rubaiyi`, daughter of Mu'awwidh b. `Afra' to describe God's messenger to him, and she replied, "If you had seen him, sonny, you would have seen the sun rising." 

Darimi transmitted it.

5657940.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657940.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657940
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 054
5657940.text:
Jabir. b. Samura said: I saw the Prophet on a cloudless[*] night and began to look at God's messenger and at the moon. He was wearing a red robe, and he appeared more beautiful than the moon to me.
*Lisan al-'arab, 19, 115, gives this meaning adding that some say it means `moonlit' and that some say it is a night when the moon shines all night. The word is idhiyan. 

Tirmidhi and Darimi transmitted it.

5657950.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657950.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657950
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 055
5657950.text:
Abu Huraira said: I have seen nothing more beautiful than God's messenger who looked as if the sun were pursuing its course in his face. And I have seen no one who walked more quickly than God's messenger, for it seemed as if the earth were being contracted for him. We would exert ourselves, but he was unruffled. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657960.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657960.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657960
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 056
5657960.text:
Jabir b. Samura said: God's messenger's legs were slender, his laughter was no more than a smile, and when I looked at him, I thought that there was collyrium in his eyes, but there was not. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5657970.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657970.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657970
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 057
5657970.text:
Ibn `Abbas said: God's messenger had spaces between his front teeth, and when he talked something like light seemed to come out between his front teeth. 

Darimi transmitted it.

5657980.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657980.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657980
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 058
5657980.text:
Ka'b b. Malik said: When God's messenger was pleased his face lit up so that it looked like a bit of a moon, and we were familiar with that. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5657990.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5657990.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5657990
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 059
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 059
5657990.text:
Anas told that when a young Jew who was a servant of the Prophet became ill, he went to visit him and found his father sitting by his head reciting the Torah. God's messenger said to him, "I adjure you, Jew, by God who sent down the Torah to Moses, do you find in the Torah any account or description of me, or anything about my coming forth?" On his replying that he did not, the young man said, "Certainly, messenger of God, I swear by God. that we do find in the Torah an account and description of you and a statement about your coming forth, and I testify that there is no god but God and that you are God's messenger." The Prophet then said to his companions, "Remove this man from beside his head and look after your brother." 

Baihaqi transmitted it in Dala'il an-nubuwwa.

5658000.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658000.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658000
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 060
5658000.text:
Abu Huraira reported the Prophet as saying, "I am just a mercy which has been bestowed." 

Darimi and Baihaqi, in Shu'ab al-iman, transmitted it.

5658010.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658010.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658010
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 061
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 061
5658010.text:
Anas said: I served the Prophet for ten years, and he never said to me, "Shame!" or "Why did you do such and such?" or "Why did you not do such and such?" 

(Bukhari And Muslim.)

5658020.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658020.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658020
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 062
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 062
5658020.text:
He said: God's messenger was one of the best of men in character. One day he sent me to do something, and I said, "I swear by God that I will not go." But in my heart, I felt I should go to do what God's messenger had commanded me; so, I went out and came upon some boys who were playing in the street. All of a sudden God's messenger who had come up behind caught me by the back of the neck, and when I looked at him, he was laughing. He said, "Did you go where I ordered you, little Anas?" and I replied, "Yes, I am on my way, messenger of God." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658030.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658030.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658030
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 063
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 063
5658030.text:
He said: When I was walking with God's messenger who was wearing a Najrani cloak with a coarse fringe, a nomadic Arab caught up on him and gave his cloak a violent tug, pulling God's Prophet back against his chest, and I saw that the side of God's messenger's shoulder was marked by the fringe of the cloak because of the violence of the man's tug. He said, "Command, that I be given some of God's property which you have, Muhammad," and God's messenger turned round to him and laughed, then ordered that he be given something. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658040.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658040.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658040
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 064
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 064
5658040.text:
He said: God's messenger was the best of men, the most generous of men, the bravest of men. One night when the people of Medina were startled and went in the direction of the sound, they were met by the Prophet who had gone in the direction of the sound before them, and he was saying, "You have nothing to fear, you have nothing to fear." He was on a bare-backed horse with no saddle belonging to Abu Talha and had a sword slung on his neck. He said, "I found it could run like a great river." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658050.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658050.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658050
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 065
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 065
5658050.text:
Jabir said that when God's messenger was asked for anything he never said, "No[*]."
*Mirqat, 5:388, explains this as meaning that he either gave what was asked or explained why he could not, and refers to Quran, 17:28. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658060.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658060.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658060
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 066
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 066
5658060.text:
Anas told that when a man had asked the Prophet for enough sheep to fill the valley between two mountains and had been given them, he went to his people and said, "Accept Islam, my people, for I swear by God that Muhammad gives gifts to such an extent that there is no fear of poverty[*]." 
*The translation depends on whether the verb is read as active or passive. The translation above takes it in the passive sense. If it is active, it means that the Prophet does not fear poverty. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658070.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658070.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658070
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 067
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 067
5658070.text:
Jubair b. Mut'im told that while he was travelling along with God's messenger returning from Hunain the nomadic Arabs persisted in making requests of him till they forced him up against an acacia tree and his cloak was snatched away[*]. The Prophet stopped and said, "Give me my cloak. If I had as many camels and sheep as these thorny trees I would divide them among you, then you would not find me niggardly, or untruthful, or cowardly." 
*This means either that it was caught by the tree, or taken by the Arabs. 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5658080.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658080.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658080
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 068
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 068
5658080.text:
Anas told that when God's messenger prayed the dawn prayer the servants in Medina brought their vessels containing water and they would not bring a vessel into which he did not dip his hand. They would often bring them on a cold morning and he would dip his hand into them. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658090.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658090.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658090
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 069
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 069
5658090.text:
He told that one of the maidservants belonging to the people of Medina would hold God's messenger by the hand and take him where she wished. 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5658100.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658100.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658100
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 070
5658100.text:
He told that a woman whose mind was affected said, "Messenger of God, I want something from you[*]." He replied, "Mother of so and so, consider which of the streets you wish so that I may accomplish what you want." He then went alone with her into a road till she got all she wanted. 
*Presumably meaning that she wished to speak to him privately about something. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658110.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658110.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658110
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 071
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 071
5658110.text:
He said that God's messenger was not unseemly in his language, or given to cursing or reviling. All he said when reproaching someone was, "What is the matter with him? May his forehead cleave to the dust!" 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5658120.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658120.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658120
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 072
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 072
5658120.text:
Abu Huraira told that when God's messenger was asked to invoke a curse on the polytheists, he replied, "I was not sent as one given to cursing; I was sent only as a mercy." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658130.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658130.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658130
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 073
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 073
5658130.text:
Abu Sa'id al-Khudri said: The Prophet was more modest than a virgin in her apartment, and when he saw anything of which he disapproved we could recognise the fact in his face. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658140.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658140.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658140
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 074
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 074
5658140.text:
`A'isha- said she never saw the Prophet laughing so immoderately that she could see his uvula, for he used only to smile. 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5658150.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658150.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658150
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 075
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 075
5658150.text:
She said: God's messenger did not go on talking rapidly as you do, but would talk in such a way that anyone who wished to count his words would be able to do so. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658160.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658160.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658160
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 076
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 076
5658160.text:
Al-Aswad told that he asked `A'isha what the Prophet used to do in his house, and she replied that he used to engage in the mihna, i.e. the service, of his family, and when the time for prayer came he went out to prayer. 

Bukhari transmitted it.

5658170.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658170.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658170
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 077
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 077
5658170.text:
`A'isha said God's messenger was never given his choice between two things without taking the lesser of them provided it involved no sin, for if it did, no one kept farther away from it than he. And God's messenger never took revenge on his own behalf for anything unless something God had forbidden had been transgressed, in which event he took revenge for it for God's sake. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658180.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658180.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658180
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 078
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 078
5658180.text:
She said God's messenger never struck anyone with his hand, neither a woman nor a servant, unless he was striving in God's path; and nothing was ever done to him for which he took revenge on the perpetrator unless things God had forbidden were transgressed, in which event he took revenge for God's sake. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658190.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658190.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658190
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 079
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 079
5658190.text:
Anas said: I served God's messenger for ten years from the time I was eight years old and he never blamed me for anything which was destroyed at my hand. If any member of his family blamed me, he said, "Leave him alone, for if anything were decreed it would happen." 

This is the wording in al-Masabih, and Baihaqi has a slightly different version in Shu'ab al-iman.

5658200.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658200.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658200
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 080
5658200.text:
`A'isha said God's messenger was not unseemly or lewd in his language, nor was he loud-voiced in the streets, nor did he return evil for evil, but he would forgive and pardon. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658210.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658210.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658210
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 081
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 081
5658210.text:
Anas used to tell of the Prophet that he would visit the sick, attend funerals, accept a slave's invitation, and ride on a donkey. He said he had seen him on a donkey at the battle for Khaibar using a rein of palm-fibres. 

Ibn Majah and Baihaqi, in Shu'ab al Iman, transmitted it.

5658220.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658220.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658220
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 082
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 082
5658220.text:
`A'isha said: God's messenger used to patch his sandals, sew his garment and conduct himself at home as anyone of you does in his house. He was a human being, searching his garment for lice, milking his sheep, and doing his own chores.

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658230.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658230.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658230
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 083
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 083
5658230.text:
Kharija b. Zaid b. Thabit told that some people visited Zaid b. Thabit and asked him to tell them some stories about God's messenger. He replied: I was his neighbour, and when the inspiration descended on him, he sent for me and I went to him and wrote it down for him. When we talked about this world, he did so along with us, when we talked about the next world, he did so along with us, and when we talked about food, he did so along with us. All this I tell you about God's messenger. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658240.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658240.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658240
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 084
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 084
5658240.text:
Anas told that when God's messenger shook hands with a man, he did not withdraw his hand till the other did so, he did not turn his face away till the other did so, and he was not seen to put forward his knees in front of one with whom he was sitting. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658250.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658250.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658250
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 085
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 085
5658250.text:
He said that God's messenger did not store up anything for the next day. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658260.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658260.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658260
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 086
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 086
5658260.text:
Jabir b. Samura said God's messenger was far from talkative[*]. 
*This is free translation expressing the meaning of the Arabic which is literally `long of silence'. The idea that he spoke only when he had good reason for doing so. Cf. Mirqat, 5:394. 

It is transmitted in Sharh as-sunna.

5658270.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658270.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658270
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 087
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 087
5658270.text:
Jabir[*] said God's messenger spoke in a distinct and leisurely manner. 
*Jabir b. Abdallah. 

Abu Dawud transmitted it.

5658280.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658280.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658280
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 088
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 088
5658280.text:
`A'isha said: God's messenger did not go on talking rapidly as you do, but spaced out his words so that those who sat with him could remember them. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658290.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658290.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658290
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 089
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 089
5658290.text:
`Abdallah b. al-Harith b. Jaz' said he had seen no one more given to smiling than God's messenger. 

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658300.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658300.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658300
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 090
5658300.text:
`Abdallah b. Salam said that when God's messenger sat talking he would often raise his eyes to the sky. 

Abu Dawud transmitted it.

5658310.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658310.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658310
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 091
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 091
5658310.text:
`Amr b. Sa`id quoted Anas as saying: I never saw anyone more kindly towards children than God's messenger. His son Ibrahim was being suckled in the `Awali of Medina[1], and he would go accompanied by us and enter the house which was full of smoke, the boy's foster-father[2] being a blacksmith. He would take him and kiss him and then go back. `Amr told that when Ibrahim died God's messenger said, "Ibrahim is my son who has died while being suckled, but he has two foster-mothers who will complete his suckling in paradise." 
1. A village in Madina province. 
2. He was Abu Samin al Bara b. Aus Al-Ansari.

Muslim transmitted it.

5658320.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658320.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658320
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 092
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 092
5658320.text:
`Ali told that God's messenger owed some dinars to so and so, a Jewish doctor, who demanded payment from the Prophet. When he said to him, "I have nothing to give you, Jew," he replied, "I will not leave you, Muhammad, till you pay me." God's messenger said, "I shall sit with you, then," and did so. God's messenger prayed the noon, afternoon, sunset, final evening and morning prayers, and his companions were threatening and menacing the man, God's messenger being aware of what they were doing. They then said, "Messenger of God, is a Jew keeping you in restraint!'' to which he replied, "My Lord has prevented me from wronging one with whom a covenant has been made, or anyone else." Then when the day was advanced the Jew said, "I testify that there is no god but God, I testify that you are God's messenger, and half my property will be devoted to God's path. I swear by God that my only purpose in treating you as I have done was that I might consider the description of you given in the Torah: `Muhammad b. 'Abdallah whose birthplace is in Mecca, whose place of emigration is in Taiba, and whose kingdom is in Syria; he is not harsh or rough, or loud-voiced in the streets, and he is not characterised by coarseness or lewd speech.' I testify that there is no god but God, and I testify that you are God's messenger. Give a decision about this property of mine according to what God has shown you." Now the Jew was very rich. 

Baihaqi transmitted it in Dala'il an-nubuwa.

5658330.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658330.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658330
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 093
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 093
5658330.text:
`Abdallah b. Abu Aufa said: God's messenger was often given to making mention of God, seldom given to idle talk, he would pray at length, deliver short sermons, not disdain to walk with a widow or a humble person, and he would accomplish for him what he needed. 

Nasai and Darimi transmitted it.

5658340.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658340.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658340
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 094
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 094
5658340.text:
`Ali told that Abu Jahl said to the Prophet, "We do not call you a liar, but we say that what you have brought is false." God most high then sent down concerning them, "They do not call you a liar, but the evildoers deny God's signs[*]." 
*Quran; 6:33.

Tirmidhi transmitted it.

5658351.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658351.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658351
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 095
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 095
5658351.text:
`A'isha reported God's messenger as saying, "If I wished, `A'isha, mountains of gold would go with me. An angel whose waist was as high as the Ka'ba came to me and told me that my Lord sent me a greeting and said that if I wished I could be a prophet and a servant, or if I wished I could be a prophet and a king. I looked at Gabriel and he gave me a sign to humble myself. (In the version by Ibn `Abbas it says that God's messenger turned to Gabriel as one asking his advice and Gabriel made a gesture with his hand indicating that he should be humble.) I then said that I would be a prophet and a servant." `A'isha said that after that God's messenger did not eat reclining, saying he would eat like a slave and sit like a slave. 

It is transmitted in Sharh as-sunna.

5658370.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658370.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658370
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 096
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 096
5658370.text:
Ibn `Abbas said God's messenger was commissioned at the age of forty, he remained in Mecca thirteen years receiving revelations, after which he was ordered to emigrate, he was an emigrant for ten years and died at the age of sixty-three. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658380.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658380.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658380
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 097
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 097
5658380.text:
He said God's messenger stayed in Mecca fifteen years hearing the voice and seeing the light for seven years, but seeing nothing along with it, and eight years during which revelations were given to him. He stayed in Medina ten years and died at the age of sixty-five. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658390.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658390.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658390
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 098
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 098
5658390.text:
Anas said God took him when he was just sixty years old. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658400.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658400.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658400
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 099
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 099
5658400.text:
He said the Prophet was taken at the age of sixty-three, Abu Bakr at the age of sixty-three, and `Umar at the age of sixty-three. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658411.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658411.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658411
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 100
5658411.text:
Muhammad b. Isma'il al-Bukhari said sixty-three is the commonest statement. `A'isha said: The first revelation God's messenger received was the true vision in sleep, and every vision he saw came like the bright gleam of dawn. He then became fond of solitude and would go alone to the cave on Hira where he would engage in tahannuth, which means worship for a number of nights, before feeling a yearning for his family. He would take provisions for that purpose, then he would return to Khadija and get provisions for a like period, till the truth came to him when he was in the cave on Hira. The angel came to him and said, `Recite,'[1] to which he replied, "I am not a reciter." He said, "He then took me and squeezed me till I was distressed, after which he let me go and said, `Recite.' When I replied, `I am not a reciter,' he took me and squeezed me a second time till I was distressed, then letting me go he said, `Recite;' When I replied, "I am not a reciter,' he took me and squeezed me a third time till I was distressed. He then let me go and said, `Recite! In the name of your Lord who created, created man from a clot of blood. Recite! And your most bountiful Lord is He who taught the use of the pen, taught man what he did not know.' "[2] 

God's messenger came back with the verses, his heart trembling, and went in to Khadija and, said "Wrap me up, wrap me up." So, they wrapped him up till the terror had left him. He then spoke to Khadija and informed her of what had happened, saying, "I fear for myself." She replied, "By no means! I swear by God that God will never shame you. You join ties of relationship, you speak the truth, you bear people's burdens, you give to the destitute, you entertain guests, and you help against the vicissitudes which affect people's rights." Khadija then took him to Waraqa b. Naufal, her paternal cousin, and said to him, "Listen, cousin, to what your nephew has to say." Waraqa said to him, "Son of my brother, what do you see?'' God's messenger then informed him about what he had seen and Waraqa said, "It is the namus[3] which God sent down to Moses. Would that I were a young man during your prophetic career! Would that I might be alive when your people expel you!" God's messenger asked, "Will they expel me?'' and he replied, "Yes; no man has ever brought anything like what you have brought without meeting hostility. If I see your day, I shall give you strong help."Waraqa died soon afterwards, and there was an intermission in the inspiration. 
1. The word iqra means either "recite" or "read". The former is to be preferred here.
2. Quran; 96:1-5. 
3. This word is most likely derived from the Greek nomos (law). It indicates the revelation of scripture in the form of a divine law such as that given to Moses. "The suggestion may also have been present that Muhammad should be the founder or legislator of a community" (W. M. Watt, Muhammad at Mecca, Oxford, 1953, p. 51).

(Bukhari and Muslim.) Bukhari added: so that the Prophet was grieved, as we have heard, and on that account went out in the morning several times to throw himself down from the heights of the mountain; but as often as he reached the summit of a mountain to throw himself from it, Gabriel appeared to him and said, "Muhammad, you are truly God's messenger." On that account his turmoil would then quieten and he would feel at ease.

5658430.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658430.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658430
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 101
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 101
5658430.text:
Jabir said he heard God's messenger telling about the intermission in the inspiration as follows: "While I was walking I heard a voice from the sky, and raising my eyes I saw the angel who had come to me on Hira sitting on a throne between heaven and earth. I was terror stricken on that account so that I fell to the ground. I then went to my family and said, `Wrap me up, wrap me up.' They wrapped me up, and then God most high sent down, `You who are shrouded, arise and deliver warning, your Lord magnify, your clothes cleanse, and defilement shun. * The inspiration then became hot and followed continuously." 
*Quran; 74:1-5

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658440.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658440.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658440
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 102
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 102
5658440.text:
`A'isha told that al-Harith b. Hisham asked God's messenger, "How does the inspiration come to you, messenger of God?" to which he replied, "It comes to me at times like the clanging of a bell, and that is the type which is most severe for me; it then leaves me, I having retained of it what the angel said. At times the angel appears to me in human form and speaks to me, and I retain what he says." `A'isha said she had seen the inspiration descending on him on a very cold day, and his forehead pouring with sweat when it left him. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658450.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658450.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658450
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 103
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 103
5658450.text:
`Ubada b. as-Samit said that when the inspiration descended on the Prophet, he was distressed on account of that and his face was altered to a dark hue. A version says, he lowered his head and his companions lowered their heads; then when it was removed from him, he raised his head.

Muslim transmitted it.

5658460.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658460.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658460
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 104
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 104
5658460.text:
Ibn `Abbas said: When "And warn your nearest relations"[1] was sent down the Prophet went out, ascended as-Safa', and began to call, "B. Fihr, B. `Adi," calling clans of Quraish until they gathered; and when a man was unable to go out, he sent a messenger to see what was the matter. When Abu Lahab arid all Quraish had come he said, "Tell me; If I were to inform you that horsemen were coming forth from the side of this mountain (a version having: were coming forth in the wadi) with the intention of making a raid on you, would you believe me?" They replied, "Yes; we have experienced nothing but truth from you." He said, "Well, I am a warner to you before a severe chastisement." Abu Lahab said, "May you perish! Is it for this you have brought us together?" Then came down, "Perish the hands of Abu Lahab and may he perish!"[2]
 Quran; 26:214
 Quran; 111 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658470.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658470.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658470
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 105
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 105
5658470.text:
`Abdallah b. Mas'ud said: While God's messenger was praying at the Ka'ba and the company of Quraish were in the places where they sat, someone said, "Which of you will go to the sacrificial camel of the family of so and so, make for the contents of its stomach, its blood and the skin over the foetus then wait and put it on his shoulders when he prostrates himself?" The most wretched one among them* then went off, and when he prostrated himself put it on his shoulders; and as the Prophet remained in prostration, they laughed to such an extent that they rolled against one another. Someone went to tell Fatima who came running, and the Prophet remained in prostration till she threw it off him, faced them and reviled them. Then when God's messenger finished the prayer, he said three times, "0 God, deal with Quraish (it being his practice when he made supplication to make it three times and when he made a request to make it three times); 
0 God, deal with 'Amr b. Hisham, `Utba b. Rabi'a, Shaiba b. Rabi'a, al Walid b. `Utba, Umayya b. Khalaf, `Uqba b. Abu Mu'ait, and `Umara b. al-Walid." `Abdallah said: I swear by God that I have seen them prostrate at the battle of Badr, after which they were dragged to the well, the well of Badr; and God's messenger said, "Those thrown into the well have been followed with a curse."
*Mirqat, 5:409, says this was either Abu Jahl, or `Uqba b. Abu Mu'ait, adding that Nawawi said it was the latter. 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658480.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658480.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658480
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 106
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 106
5658480.text:
`A'isha told that she asked God's messenger whether he had experienced a day more severe than that of Uhud, and that he replied, "I have experienced things from your people, but the most severe thing I experienced from them was on the day of the `Aqaba when I offered myself to Ibn `Abd Yalil b. Kulal and he did not agree to what I wanted.1 I then went off full of care not noticing where I was going, and did not come to my senses till I was at Qarn ath-Tha'alib[2]. Raising my head, I saw a cloud which overshadowed me, and when I looked, I saw Gabriel in it. He called to me, told me God had heard the words of my people and their rejection of me, and said He had sent me the angel of the mountains for me to order him to do to them what I wanted. The angel of the mountains then called to me, saying, after giving me a salutation, `God has heard the words of your people, Muhammad, and I am the angel of the mountains whom your Lord has sent to you to order me if you wish to cover them with al-Akhshaban[3].'" God's messenger replied, "No, I hope God may bring forth from their loins people who will worship God alone, associating nothing with Him." 
 Ibn 'Abd Yalil belonged to at-Ta'if. His father was one of the leading men, but he was 'Abd Ya`lil b. 'Amr b. `Umair (see Isti'ab, p. 410).
 Yaqut, Mu'jam, 4:72, sats it is a day and a night's journey from Mecca when one comes from Najd.
 Two hills near Mecca. Cf. Yaqut, Mu'jam, 1:163.

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658490.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658490.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658490
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 107
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 107
5658490.text:
Anas told that when one of God's messenger's teeth between the front and the canine teeth was broken at the battle of Uhud and a cut was made in his head, he began to remove the blood from himself and say, "How can a people who have split the head of their prophet and broken his tooth next to his eyetooth prosper?'' 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658500.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658500.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658500
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 108
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 108
5658500.text:
Abu Huraira reported God's messenger as saying, "God is very angry with people who have done this to their prophet (pointing to the tooth next his eyetooth). God is very angry with a man who is killed by God's messenger in God's path." 

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658510.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658510.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658510
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 109
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 109
5658510.text:
Yahya b. Abu Kathir said: I asked Abu Salama b. `Abd ar Rahman about the first portion of the Quran to come down, and he replied that it was, "O you who are shrouded . . ."[1] I told him that people said it was, "Recite! In the name of your Lord," [2] and Abu Salama replied that he had asked Jabir about that, saying to him the. same kind of thing as I had just said, and that Jabir had replied that he would tell me only what God's messenger had told him. He had said, "I stayed in Hira for a month, and when I had finished my stay, I came down. A call was made to me and I looked to my right but saw nothing; I looked to my left but saw nothing; I looked behind me but saw nothing; then when I raised my head and saw something I went to Khadija and said, `Wrap me up.' They did so, and poured cold water over me, and then `You who are shrouded, arise and deliver warning, your Lord magnify, your clothes cleanse, and defilement shun,' came down." He said that was before the prayer was made obligatory. 
 Quran, 74. 
 Quran, 94.

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658520.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658520.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658520
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 110
5658520.text:
Anas told that Gabriel came to God's messenger when he was playing with some other boys, seized him, threw him down, split open his heart and took out of it a clot of blood, saying, "This is the devil's portion in you." He then washed it with Zamzam water in a gold dish, repaired it, and put it back in its place. The boys went running to his mother, i.e., his foster-mother, saying, "Muhammad has been killed," so they went to him and found him looking upset. Anas said he used to see the mark of the sewing in his breast. 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658530.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658530.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658530
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 111
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 111
5658530.text:
Jabir b. Samura reported God's messenger as saying, "I know a stone in Mecca which used to give me a salutation before I received my commission, and indeed I know it now." 

Muslim transmitted it.

5658540.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658540.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658540
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 112
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 112
5658540.text:
Anas said that when the people of Mecca asked God's messenger to show them a sign, he showed them the moon in two pieces between which they were able to see Hira.

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658550.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658550.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658550
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 113
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 113
5658550.text:
Ibn Mas'ud said that in the time of God's messenger the moon was split in two portions, one above the mountain and one below it, and God's messenger said, "Testify." [*]
*A call to the people to testify to his prophetic office, or to the miracle.

(Bukhari and Muslim.)

5658560.book: Excellent Qualities and Description of the Prophet
5658560.reference:
Reference  : Mishkat al-Masabih 5658560
In-book reference  : Book 29, Hadith 114
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 29, Hadith 114
5658560.text:
Abu Huraira told that Abu Jahl said, "Does Muhammad rub his face in the dust among you?" and that when he was told that he did he said, "I swear by al-Lat and al-`Uzza that if I see him do that I will tramp on his neck." He then came to God's messenger when he was praying with the purpose of tramping on his neck, but all of a sudden, he was sitting back on his heels and warding off something with his hands. He was asked what was the matter with him and replied, "Between him and me there are a trench of fire, something which causes terror, and wings." God's messenger said, "If he had come near me the angels would have snatched him limb by limb." 

Muslim transmitted it.
